p: Cholinesterases (ChEs) inhibitors can increase the levels of ACh and contribute to upregulate the cholinergic tone in neurons, partially ameliorating cognitive symptoms. AChE is a particularly attractive target to address AD-related symptoms, not only for its catalytic functions but also for the effects on A Î² precipitation, plaque formation [ 29], and inflammation. As discussed before, a few compounds have made their appearance in the market, like Donepezil or Rivastigmine ( 2 and 4, Figure 1), which were approved for the treatment of mild-to-moderate AD symptoms.
